cards.name: Acid Rain
cards.text: Destroy all Forests.

cards.name: Aesthir Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Aesthir Glider can't block.
cards.flavor:
"Sacrilege! A noble ally in life, made nothing more than a glorified kite in death!"
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

cards.name: Al-abara's Carpet
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures without flying.
cards.flavor: Al-abara simply laughed and lifted one finger, and the carpet carried her high out of our reach.

cards.name: Alaborn Musketeer
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Muskets gave the Alaborn army an advantage it had long lacked—air defense.

cards.name: Alaborn Trooper
cards.flavor:
"I dedicate my body to my country
And my life to my King."
—Alaborn Soldier's Oath

cards.name: Aladdin
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Gain control of target artifact for as long as you control Aladdin.

cards.name: Alchor's Tomb
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target permanent you control becomes the color of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.name: Ali from Cairo
cards.text: Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

cards.name: Alluring Scent
cards.text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
cards.flavor: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.

cards.name: Amulet of Kroog
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing, greatly adding to the city's glory.

cards.name: Angelic Voices
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 as long as you control no nonartifact, nonwhite creatures.

cards.name: Animate Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
As long as enchanted artifact isn't a creature, it's an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Argivian Blacksmith
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target artifact creature this turn.
cards.flavor: Through years of study and training, the Blacksmiths of Argive became adept at reassembling the mangled remains of the strange, mechanical creatures abounding in their native land.

cards.name: Argothian Pixies
cards.text:
Argothian Pixies can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Pixies by artifact creatures.

cards.name: Argothian Treefolk
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Treefolk by artifact sources.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.flavor:
"‘O miserable of happy! Is this the end
Of this new glorious world . . . ?'"
—John Milton, Paradise Lost

cards.name: Armageddon Clock
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock.
At the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage equal to the number of doom counters on it to each player.
{4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

cards.name: Artifact Blast
cards.text: Counter target artifact spell.
cards.flavor: The first line of defense against Urza and Mishra, the Artifact Blast achieved widespread fame until an unlucky mage discovered it was useless on the devices the brothers had already created.

cards.name: Ashnod's Altar
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Add {2} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Atog
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Badlands
cards.text: ({T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Balance
cards.text: Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

cards.name: Basalt Monolith
cards.text:
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
{3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.

cards.name: Bayou
cards.text: ({T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Bee Sting
cards.text: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
Busy as a bumblebee, blistered as a goblin.
—Alaborn saying

cards.name: Bird Maiden
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"Four things that never meet do here unite To shed my blood and to ravage my heart, A radiant brow and tresses that beguile And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

cards.name: Blaze of Glory
cards.text:
Cast Blaze of Glory only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature defending player controls can block any number of creatures this turn. It blocks each attacking creature this turn if able.

cards.name: Blue Elemental Blast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target red spell.
• Destroy target red permanent.

cards.name: Book of Rass
cards.text: {2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

cards.name: Bottle of Suleiman
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

cards.name: Braingeyser
cards.text: Target player draws X cards.

cards.name: Brass Man
cards.text:
Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.

cards.name: Bronze Horse
cards.text:
Trample
As long as you control another creature, prevent all damage that would be dealt to Bronze Horse by spells that target it.

cards.name: Candelabra of Tawnos
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Untap X target lands.
cards.flavor: Tawnos learned quickly from Urza that utter simplicity often led to wondrous, yet subtle utility.

cards.name: Celestial Sword
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"So great is its power, only the chosen can wield it and live."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

cards.name: Champion Lancer
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.
cards.flavor: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.

cards.name: Channel
cards.text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Citanul Druid
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts an artifact spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Citanul Druid.

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Clay Statue
cards.text: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.
cards.flavor: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

cards.name: Clockwork Avian
cards.text:
Flying
Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Clockwork Gnomes
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact creature.
cards.flavor:
"Until I came to the Floating Isle, I never had to oil the servants."
—Baki, wizard attendant

cards.name: Clockwork Swarm
cards.text:
Clockwork Swarm enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Swarm can't be blocked by Walls.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Swarm attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Cloud Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Dragon can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Cloud Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Spirit can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Colossus of Sardia
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor: Buried under a thin layer of dirt, it was known for centuries as Mount Sardia.

cards.name: Control Magic
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

cards.name: Conversion
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Conversion unless you pay {W}{W}.
All Mountains are Plains.

cards.name: Copy Artifact
cards.text: You may have Copy Artifact enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield, except it's an enchantment in addition to its other types.

cards.name: Coral Helm
cards.text: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Crumble
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Cyclone
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wind counter on Cyclone, then sacrifice Cyclone unless you pay {G} for each wind counter on it. If you pay, Cyclone deals damage equal to the number of wind counters on it to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Cyclopean Mummy
cards.text: When Cyclopean Mummy dies, exile it.

cards.name: Cyclopean Tomb
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Put a mire counter on target non-Swamp land. That land is a Swamp for as long as it has a mire counter on it. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
When Cyclopean Tomb is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game, remove all mire counters from a land that a mire counter was put onto with Cyclopean Tomb but that a mire counter has not been removed from with Cyclopean Tomb.

cards.name: Dakmor Plague
cards.text: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Deathcoil Wurm
cards.text: You may have Deathcoil Wurm assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Deathgrip
cards.text: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.

cards.name: Demonic Hordes
cards.text:
{T}: Destroy target land.
At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you pay {B}{B}{B}, tap Demonic Hordes and sacrifice a land of an opponent's choice.
cards.flavor: Created to destroy Dominiaria, demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

cards.name: Demonic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Detonate
cards.text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

cards.name: Devastation
cards.text: Destroy all creatures and lands.
cards.flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

cards.name: Diabolic Machine
cards.text: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.
cards.flavor:
"The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."
—Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

cards.name: Divine Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Dragon Engine
cards.text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.

cards.name: Drain Power
cards.text: Target player activates a mana ability of each land he or she controls. Then put all mana from that player's mana pool into yours.

cards.name: Dread Reaper
cards.text:
Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.

cards.name: Dread Wight
cards.text: At end of combat, put a paralyzation counter on each creature blocking or blocked by Dread Wight and tap those creatures. Each of those creatures doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as it has a paralyzation counter on it. Each of those creatures gains "{4}: Remove a paralyzation counter from this creature."

cards.name: Drop of Honey
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy the creature with the least power. It can't be regenerated. If two or more creatures are tied for least power, you choose one of them.
When there are no creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Drop of Honey.

cards.name: Drowned
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drowned.
cards.flavor: We asked Captain Soll what became of the Serafina, but all he said was, "Ships that go down shouldn't come back up."

cards.name: Dust to Dust
cards.text: Exile two target artifacts.
cards.flavor:
"All this nonsense made by mages Rusts and crumbles through the ages."
—Aline Corralurn, "Inheritance"

cards.name: Ebon Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Ebon Dragon enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent discard a card.

cards.name: Ebony Horse
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

cards.name: Ebony Rhino
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor:
"That Rhino would fetch us a tidy sum, Joven. Perhaps it's time to make it ours."
—Chandler

cards.name: Elephant Graveyard
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Regenerate target Elephant.

cards.name: Elite Cat Warrior
cards.text: Forestwalk
cards.flavor: "Hear that? No? That's a cat warrior."

cards.name: Energy Flux
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

cards.name: Eye for an Eye
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

cards.name: False Summoning
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Fastbond
cards.text:
You may play any number of lands on each of your turns.
Whenever you play a land, if it wasn't the first land you played this turn, Fastbond deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Fire Imp
cards.text: When Fire Imp enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Fire Tempest
cards.text: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

cards.name: Floodwater Dam
cards.text: {X}{X}{1}, {T}: Tap X target lands.
cards.flavor: Viscerid dams may be of living creatures as well as bones and mud.

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

cards.name: Fork
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell, except that the copy is red. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Foul Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
When Foul Spirit enters the battlefield, sacrifice a land.

cards.name: Gaea's Avenger
cards.text: Gaea's Avenger's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of artifacts your opponents control.

cards.name: Gate to Phyrexia
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target artifact. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"The warm rain of grease on my face immediately made it clear I had entered Phyrexia."
—Jarsyl, Diary

cards.name: Gauntlet of Might
cards.text:
Red creatures get +1/+1.
Whenever a Mountain is tapped for mana, its controller adds {R} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Tortoise
cards.text: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

cards.name: Goblin Bully
cards.flavor: It's easy to stand head and shoulders over those with no backbone.

cards.name: Goblin Cavaliers
cards.flavor: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

cards.name: Goblin Caves
cards.text:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +0/+2.

cards.name: Goblin Firestarter
cards.text: Sacrifice Goblin Firestarter: Goblin Firestarter deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.name: Goblin General
cards.text: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Lead, follow, or run like crazy.

cards.name: Goblin Shrine
cards.text:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +1/+0.
When Goblin Shrine leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each Goblin creature.

cards.name: Goblin Warrens
cards.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

cards.name: Gorilla War Cry
cards.text:
Cast Gorilla War Cry only during combat before blockers are declared.
Creatures can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Grapeshot Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: For years scholars debated whether these were Urza's or Mishra's creations. Recent research suggests they were invented by the brothers' original master, Tocasia, and that both used these devices.

cards.name: Gravebind
cards.text:
Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Guardian Beast
cards.text: As long as Guardian Beast is untapped, noncreature artifacts you control can't be enchanted, they have indestructible, and other players can't gain control of them. This effect doesn't remove Auras already attached to those artifacts.

cards.name: Harsh Justice
cards.text:
Cast Harsh Justice only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
This turn, whenever an attacking creature deals combat damage to you, it deals that much damage to its controller.

cards.name: Hasran Ogress
cards.text: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Horn of Deafening
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
cards.flavor: "A blast, an echo . . . then silence."

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ice Cauldron
cards.text:
{X}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Ice Cauldron and exile a nonland card from your hand. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled. Note the type and amount of mana spent to pay this activation cost. Activate this ability only if there are no charge counters on Ice Cauldron.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Ice Cauldron: Add Ice Cauldron's last noted type and amount of mana to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast the last card exiled with Ice Cauldron.

cards.name: Icy Manipulator
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: In the Eye of Chaos
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an instant spell, counter it unless that player pays {X}, where X is its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Instill Energy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

cards.name: Ironhoof Ox
cards.text: Ironhoof Ox can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: The good news is it's vegetarian. The bad news is it just doesn't like you.

cards.name: Island Sanctuary
cards.text: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

cards.name: Jade Monolith
cards.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.flavor: We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.

cards.name: Junún Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junún Efreet unless you pay {B}{B}.

cards.name: Just Fate
cards.text:
Cast Just Fate only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Destroy target attacking creature.

cards.name: Kismet
cards.text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

cards.name: Kormus Bell
cards.text: All Swamps are 1/1 black creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Kudzu
cards.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller attaches Kudzu to a land of his or her choice.

cards.name: Last Chance
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

cards.name: Lava Flow
cards.text: Destroy target creature or land.

cards.name: Leeches
cards.text: Target player loses all poison counters. Leeches deals that much damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"Where our potions and powders fail, perhaps nature will succeed."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

cards.name: Library of Alexandria
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have exactly seven cards in hand.

cards.name: Library of Leng
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.

cards.name: Lich
cards.text:
As Lich enters the battlefield, you lose life equal to your life total.
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.
Whenever you're dealt damage, sacrifice that many nontoken permanents. If you can't, you lose the game.
When Lich is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you lose the game.

cards.name: Lifeforce
cards.text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.

cards.name: Lim-Dûl's Cohort
cards.text: Whenever Lim-Dûl's Cohort blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature can't be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Living Lands
cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Living Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Regenerate Living Wall.
cards.flavor: Some fiendish mage had created a horrifying wall of living flesh, patched together from a jumble of still-recognizable body parts. As we sought to hew our way through it, some unknown power healed the gaping wounds we cut, denying us passage.

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood amongst the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

cards.name: Mana Matrix
cards.text: Instant and enchantment spells you cast cost up to {2} less to cast.

cards.name: Mana Vault
cards.text:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Martyr's Cry
cards.text: Exile all white creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller draws a card.
cards.flavor:
"It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge."
—Vervamon the Elder

cards.name: Martyrs of Korlis
cards.text: As long as Martyrs of Korlis is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by artifacts is dealt to Martyrs of Korlis instead.

cards.name: Maze of Ith
cards.text: {T}: Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

cards.name: Mightstone
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: While exploring the sacred cave of Koilos with his brother Mishra and their master Tocasia, Urza fell behind in the Hall of Tagsin, where he discovered the remarkable Mightstone.

cards.name: Mijae Djinn
cards.text: Whenever Mijae Djinn attacks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Mijae Djinn from combat and tap it.

cards.name: Minion of Tevesh Szat
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Minion of Tevesh Szat deals 2 damage to you unless you pay {B}{B}.
{T}: Target creature gets +3/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"A minion given over to Tevesh Szat is a stronger minion gained."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Mishra's Workshop
cards.text: {T}: Add {3} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells.
cards.flavor: Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.

cards.name: Mystic Decree
cards.text: All creatures lose flying and islandwalk.
cards.flavor:
"Curse Reveka, and curse her coddled conjurers. Their sorcerers' school shall yet be ours."
—Irini Sengir

cards.name: Naked Singularity
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If tapped for mana, Plains produce {R}, Islands produce {G}, Swamps produce {W}, Mountains produce {U}, and Forests produce {B} instead of any other type.

cards.name: Oasis
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

cards.name: Obelisk of Undoing
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Return target permanent you both own and control to your hand.
cards.flavor: The Battle of Tomakul taught Urza not to rely on fickle reinforcements.

cards.name: Obsianus Golem
cards.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . ."
—"Song of the Artificer"

cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster
cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
cards.flavor: Three little goblins, enjoying their brew. One bumped an ogre, and then there were two.

cards.name: Onulet
cards.text: When Onulet dies, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

cards.name: Orcish Mechanics
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Orcish Mechanics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Osai Vultures
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, put a carrion counter on Osai Vultures.
Remove two carrion counters from Osai Vultures: Osai Vultures gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Overwhelming Forces
cards.text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.

cards.name: Owl Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Pentagram of the Ages
cards.text: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor: "Take this item, for instance. How would it destroy us, Relicbane?" —Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Personal Incarnation
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she owns Personal Incarnation.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half his or her life, rounded up.

cards.name: Phantasmal Forces
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

cards.name: Planar Gate
cards.text: Creature spells you cast cost up to {2} less to cast.
cards.flavor: Nireya reached through the Gate, sensing the energies trapped beyond.

cards.name: Plateau
cards.text: ({T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Power Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact's activated abilities cost {2} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the amount of mana an ability costs to activate to less than one mana.

cards.name: Primal Clay
cards.text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

cards.name: Primitive Justice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Primitive Justice, you may pay {1}{R} and/or {1}{G} any number of times.
Destroy target artifact. For each additional {1}{R} you paid, destroy another target artifact. For each additional {1}{G} you paid, destroy another target artifact, and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

cards.name: Prowling Nightstalker
cards.text: Prowling Nightstalker can't be blocked except by black creatures.
cards.flavor: Silent as a serpent, twisted as a lone bog tree, evil as Tojira's heart.

cards.name: Radjan Spirit
cards.text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Rain of Daggers
cards.text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. You lose 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.
cards.flavor: Knives in the sky, cries in the air, and blood on the ground.

cards.name: Rakalite
cards.text: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Return Rakalite to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Urza was the first to understand that the war would not be lost for lack of power, but for lack of troops.

cards.name: Reconstruction
cards.text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

cards.name: Red Elemental Blast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target blue spell.
• Destroy target blue permanent.

cards.name: Regrowth
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Righteous Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.

cards.name: Ring of Renewal
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Discard a card at random, then draw two cards.
cards.flavor: To the uninitiated, the Ring of Renewal is merely an oddity. For those fluent in the wielding of magic, however, it is a source of great knowledge.

cards.name: Roc of Kher Ridges
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Rock Hydra
cards.text:
Rock Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
For each 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra, if it has a +1/+1 counter on it, remove a +1/+1 counter from it and prevent that 1 damage.
{R}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Rock Hydra. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Rockslide Ambush
cards.text: Rockslide Ambush deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

cards.name: Sandstorm
cards.text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
cards.flavor: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

cards.name: Savannah
cards.text: ({T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Savannah Lions
cards.flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless flat plains of their homeland.

cards.name: Scarecrow
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: There was more malice in its button eyes than should have been possible in something that had never known life.

cards.name: Scarwood Bandits
cards.text:
Forestwalk
{2}{G}, {T}: Unless an opponent pays {2}, gain control of target artifact for as long as Scarwood Bandits remains on the battlefield.

cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Scavenging Ghoul
cards.text:
At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

cards.name: Scrubland
cards.text: ({T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Sea Serpent
cards.text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

cards.name: Sedge Troll
cards.text:
Sedge Troll gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.
{B}: Regenerate Sedge Troll.
cards.flavor: The stench in the hovel was overpowering; something loathsome was cooking. Occasionally something surfaced in the thick paste, but my host would casually push it down before I could make out what it was.

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

cards.name: Serendib Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a land. If you sacrifice an Island this way, Serendib Djinn deals 3 damage to you.
When you control no lands, sacrifice Serendib Djinn.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavor: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

cards.name: Serra Aviary
cards.text: Creatures with flying get +1/+1.
cards.flavor:
"Serra, like Feroz, is long since dead. But remember, Daria: her spirit shall survive so long as the Homelands do."
—Taysir

cards.name: Serra Bestiary
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Serra Bestiary unless you pay {W}{W}.
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.

cards.name: Shapeshifter
cards.text:
As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7.
Shapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.

cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: While it's true most Dragons are cruel, the Shivan Dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

cards.name: Sinkhole
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Sleight of Hand
cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Smoke
cards.text: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.

cards.name: Sol Ring
cards.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Soldevi Golem
cards.text:
Soldevi Golem doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may untap target tapped creature an opponent controls. If you do, untap Soldevi Golem.
cards.flavor: Slow and steady wins the race.

cards.name: Soldevi Machinist
cards.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to activate abilities of artifacts.

cards.name: Soul Shred
cards.text: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Southern Elephant
cards.flavor: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

cards.name: Spotted Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: When the cat flies and the bird stalks, guard your horses carefully.

cards.name: Squall
cards.text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . .
The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam

cards.name: Staff of Zegon
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Though Mishra was impressed by the staves Ashnod had created for Zegon's defense, he understood they only hinted at her full potential.

cards.name: Stasis
cards.text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

cards.name: Steam Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.flavor: "You idiots! Turn it around! Turn it around!"

cards.name: Strip Mine
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

cards.name: Sylvan Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

cards.name: Symbol of Unsummoning
cards.text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: ". . . inviting the soul to wander for a spell in abysses of solitude . . . ." —Kate Chopin, The Awakening

cards.name: Tablet of Epityr
cards.text: Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Originally considered the work of Urza, this tablet was created by forgers seeking to imitate Urza's masterpieces.

cards.name: Taiga
cards.text: ({T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Talas Researcher
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.flavor:
From time, knowledge.
From knowledge, power.

cards.name: Tawnos's Wand
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Tawnos's Weaponry
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.
cards.flavor: When Urza's war machines became too costly, Tawnos's weaponry replaced them.

cards.name: Temple Acolyte
cards.text: When Temple Acolyte enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Young, yes. Inexperienced, yes. Weak? Don't count on it.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Tetravus
cards.text:
Flying
Tetravus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove any number of +1/+1 counters from Tetravus. If you do, put that many 1/1 colorless Tetravite artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield. They each have flying and "This creature can't be enchanted."
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile any number of tokens put onto the battlefield with Tetravus. If you do, put that many +1/+1 counters on Tetravus.

cards.name: Theft of Dreams
cards.text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor: Energy is never lost, only transformed.

cards.name: Thing from the Deep
cards.text: Whenever Thing from the Deep attacks, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an Island.
cards.flavor: Seafarers fear sailing off the world's edge not so much as down its gullet.

cards.name: Thunder Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Thunder Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Time Vault
cards.text:
Time Vault enters the battlefield tapped.
Time Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
If you would begin your turn while Time Vault is tapped, you may skip that turn instead. If you do, untap Time Vault.
{T}: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Titania's Song
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

cards.name: Transmute Artifact
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact. If you do, search your library for an artifact card. If that card's converted mana cost is less than or equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost, put it onto the battlefield. If it's greater, you may pay {X}, where X is the difference. If you do, put it onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Triassic Egg
cards.text:
{3}, {T}: Put a hatchling counter on Triassic Egg.
Sacrifice Triassic Egg: Choose one —
• You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if two or more hatchling counters are on Triassic Egg.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only if two or more hatchling counters are on Triassic Egg.

cards.name: Tropical Island
cards.text: ({T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Tsunami
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.

cards.name: Tundra
cards.text: ({T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Two-Headed Giant of Foriys
cards.text:
Trample
Two-Headed Giant of Foriys can block an additional creature.

cards.name: Underground Sea
cards.text: ({T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Urza's Chalice
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: When sorely wounded or tired, Urza would often retreat to the workshops of his apprentices. They were greatly amazed at how much better he looked each time he took a sip of water.

cards.name: Urza's Mine
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

cards.name: Urza's Mine
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

cards.name: Urza's Mine
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

cards.name: Urza's Mine
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

cards.name: Urza's Miter
cards.text: Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, if it wasn't sacrificed, you may pay {3}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Urza's Power Plant
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Artifact construction requires immense resources.

cards.name: Urza's Power Plant
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Artifact construction requires immense resources.

cards.name: Urza's Power Plant
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Artifact construction requires immense resources.

cards.name: Urza's Power Plant
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Artifact construction requires immense resources.

cards.name: Urza's Tower
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Urza always put Tocasia's lessons on resource-gathering to effective use.

cards.name: Urza's Tower
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Urza always put Tocasia's lessons on resource-gathering to effective use.

cards.name: Urza's Tower
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Urza always put Tocasia's lessons on resource-gathering to effective use.

cards.name: Urza's Tower
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.
cards.flavor: Urza always put Tocasia's lessons on resource-gathering to effective use.

cards.name: Veteran Bodyguard
cards.text: As long as Veteran Bodyguard is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures is dealt to Veteran Bodyguard instead.
cards.flavor: Good bodyguards are hard to find, mainly because they don't live long.

cards.name: Vibrating Sphere
cards.text:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get -0/-2.
cards.flavor:
"Unearthly and invisible fibers emanate from this sphere, entangling all who draw near."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Volcanic Island
cards.text: ({T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: War Mammoth
cards.text: Trample

cards.name: Warp Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Water Elemental
cards.flavor: Unpredictable as the sea itself, water elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

cards.name: Weakstone
cards.text: Attacking creatures get -1/-0.
cards.flavor: During the brothers' childhood, Tocasia took them to explore the sacred cave of Koilos. There, in the Hall of Tagsin, Mishra discovered the mysterious weakstone.

cards.name: Wheel of Fortune
cards.text: Each player discards his or her hand, then draws seven cards.

cards.name: Whiptail Wurm
cards.flavor: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

cards.name: Wicked Pact
cards.text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.

cards.name: Wild Aesthir
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
{W}{W}: Wild Aesthir gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"High in the Karplusans, death is swift and razor-clawed."
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain

cards.name: Wild Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Two little goblins, out in the sun. Down came a griffin, and then there was one.

cards.name: Wild Ox
cards.text: Swampwalk
cards.flavor: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.

cards.name: Wood Elemental
cards.text:
As Wood Elemental enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of untapped Forests.
Wood Elemental's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests sacrificed as it entered the battlefield.

cards.name: Word of Command
cards.text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. You control that player until Word of Command finishes resolving. The player plays that card if able. While doing so, the player can activate mana abilities only if they're from lands he or she controls and only if mana they produce is spent to activate other mana abilities of lands he or she controls and/or play that card. If the chosen card is cast as a spell, you control the player while that spell is resolving.

cards.name: Xenic Poltergeist
cards.text: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Yotian Soldier
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: After Kroog was destroyed while most of its defenders were at his side, Urza vowed that none of his allies would ever need to fear for their own defense again, even while laying siege to a city far from their homes.

cards.name: Zombie Master
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk.
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.flavor: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.
